comment.author: 26105073@N03
comment._content: Reg NC15061 Type Sikorsky S-43 c/n 4301X X15061 History Owners Sikorsky - Inter Island Airways -- Inter-Island Airways flew amphibian planes between John Rodgers Airport on Oahu and the neighbor islands on regularly scheduled passenger and freight service in the 1930s. Date June, 1935 (UNK.... not this photo) Certif. of Registration: Sikorsky Fate/Comments Withdrawn from use April 26, 1946 My Flying Boats & Seaplanes set on Flickr; please visit! My info source is: www.goldenyears.ukf.net/reg_N48.htm, and Hawaii.gov aviation history.

comment.author: 56549490@N02
comment._content: Is this the plane Howard Hughes crashed into Lake Mead? I believe there were two fatalities?

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/56549490@N02] It was a S-43, but not this particular one.
